riddle: What has to be broken before you can use it?
I’m tall when I’m young, and I’m short when I’m old. What am I?
What word looks the same upside down and backward?
What does through cities, over hills, and around towns, but never moves?
What has a lot of keys but can't open any doors?
What has keys but no locks, and space but not room?
If you have one, you don't share it; if you share it, you don't have it. What is it?
What starts out tall, but the longer it stands, the shorter it grows?
What loses it's head every morning, but gets it back at night?
What do you call a bear without an ear?
What has 13 hearts, but no other organ?
What five-letter word  becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
What has two hands, a round face, always runs, but stays in place?
Professor Blue lives in the blue house, Mr. Pink lives in the pink house, and Doctor Brown lives in the brown house. Who lives in the white house?
answer: The president of the United States of America

riddle: What starts with a P and ends with an E and has a million of letters in it?
What gets wetter as it dries?
What does December have that other months don't have?
What has hands but can't clap?
The more there is the less you see….
What can be cracked, made, told, and played?
What question can you never answer yes to?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest person can’t hold me for five minutes. What am I?
What runs, but never walks. Murmurs, but never talks. Has a bed, but never sleeps. And has a mouth, but never eats?
What is so fragile that saying its name breaks it?
What has a neck but has no head?
What has many hearts but no other organs?
What has a head and a tail but no body?
